subject: Trying to re-invent the wheel---SB#36 upgraded
author: urkel23@aol.com
full_text:
--part1_1f0ea.265a374a.3a512dfe_boundary
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="part1_1f0ea.265a374a.3a512dfe_alt_boundary"


--part1_1f0ea.265a374a.3a512dfe_alt_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit


Even though the 12-589 radio is a piece of crap, i still try and work on it 
 to make it better.  I finally got all the voltages to match using the  
TS924IN op amp, but it still sucks.
 
I love this chip though, really blows away the LM324 that i had been  
using.  Thanks Jeff for letting me know about it.  If it wasn't for  Jeff guiding 
my path, i'm not sure i'd be doing anything worthwhile.
 
I think 2011 is the year i start understanding more, some stuff is actually 
 making sense to me lately.  I've attached 2 videos with the new set up in  
this radio.
 
-Steve
 
 
 
Steve Hultay
_www.keyportparanormal.com_ (http://www.keyportparanormal.com/)
